snippet: The reports in state media are the closest thing to an official Chinese response to the revelations, which have come at an uncomfortable time for the United States.
abstract: Chinese state news media highlights revelations that the United States is engaged in widespread monitoring of Internet and telephone communications, carrying reports suggesting National Security Agency disclosures could damage US-Chinese relations; disclosures come at uncomfortable time for US.

byline.original: By GERRY MULLANY and DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
byline.contributor: Gerry Mullany reported from Hong Kong, and Didi Kirsten Tatlow from Beijing. Patrick Zuo contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The reports in state media are the closest thing to an official Chinese response to the revelations, which have come at an uncomfortable time for the United States.

headline.main: Chinese State Media Suggest That N.S.A. Disclosures Will Hurt U.S. Ties
headline.print_headline: Chinese State Media Suggest That N.S.A. Disclosures Will Hurt U.S. Ties
